page.title: 10PEAT CUTTING IN EDDERTON
page.content: You go{peat cutting}on a heather moor near water which makes the soil wet. Firstly you{skim}the heather off the top which is considered to be the toughest job.You begin to cut out the peat with a{tusker.}You cut your peat where the soil is damp other wise the peat will crumble.Once you have cut the peats you throw them on to the bank and then{stack}them.Then you leave the peat stacks for a few days to dry slightly in the wind.After they have dried for a while you take them home and stack them like a wall beside the house.The best time to go peat cutting is around May and June and you take them home in July or August.You are not meant to burn them for a year as they will not have dried thoroughly.You can then burn them.
